attributes.comment:
Dear USCIS -

This is in response to the fee increases that have been prosposed on several of
the application processing fees. Increasing fees will not result in less immigrants.
It will most certainly increase the number of illegal immigrants in the country at
the current time. Fees being increased so much will scare new immigrants away
from filing for residency or other documents as needed. Instead they will hide
away. Wait times are long, but long wait times are better than increased fees and
increased illegal immigrants.

Not only will it increase your fees, but also it will increase complaints and the
work that is done outside of the actual service centers. Currently fees are at a
high rate, especially for a new immigrants and therefore many complaints will be
filed by increasing fees. This will only cause more work for you in responding to
such complaints. The time saved will be minimal if any, and more than likely will
increase problems.

After reviewing the policy, I think that you will agree that increasing fees will not
increase revenues for the company, will not decrease the number of immigrants
coming to the United States, but only those coming illegaly, and will greatly
increase the headaches of each and every individual at your company. The new
fee proposals should be rejected and left where they are at to keep things going
slowly but smoothly.

Sincerely,

Jeff Tenney
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jeff Tenney
